result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler W McGinnis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Payments of $50 per month beginning 11-30-16.  If payment is not received as ordered the Def. is ordered to serve  12  days in the Jefferson County Jail consecutive. *****

--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without a valid prescription
--no contact with Mitchell Barron or any other known drug offender except for treatment, per Agent

The Court grants Mr. McGinnis expungement upon successful completion of Probation

Case called at 1:49pm [mo]
Defendant Tyler W McGinnis in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Humes notes that the Information was not filed timely, but Atty. Humes nor Mr. McGinnis object to proceeding.
--The Court raises that it does not believe that untimely filling of the Information can be waived; suggests amending the Criminal Complaint

ADA Shock motions to amend Count #1 to Possession of Cocaine contrary to 961.41(3g)(c), Wis. Stat. an unclassified misdemeanor
--The Court grants this motion 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Amended Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
On Amended Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to serve 7 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work-release privileges, to commence on     10/13/15 at   7:00pm.
---Mr. McGinnis is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening (at least once per month for first three months; thereafter, at the discretion of the Agent)
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without a valid prescription
--no contact with Mitchell Barron or any other known drug offender except for treatment, per Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay Buy Money Reimbursement in the amount of $150 (joint and several with Mitchell Barron)


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The Court finds that society will not be harmed and Mr. McGinnis will benefit from expungement.
The Court grants Mr. McGinnis expungement upon successful completion of Probation 
recess: 2:23pm

[MK] case called at 9:38am. 
Attorney Samantha J. Humes in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Arraignment today, however Defendant Tyler McGinnis does not appear.
Attorney Humes indicates that she spoke with Mr. McGinnis by telephone this morning. Mr. McGinnis had this hearing mis-calendared for tomorrow morning.   Attorney Humes indicates that there is an accepted Criminal Case Settlement in place.  
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court authorizes issuance of a Bench Warrant but stays that Warrant to 10/8/15 at 1:15pm.
recess 9:44am. 

NEXT:  schedule Arraignment and Plea/Sentencing on 10/8/15 at 1:15pm (same date and time as co-defendant)

Case called at 1:34 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Tyler W McGinnis in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. McGinnis waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
ADA Beck informs the Court that they have not yet made a charging decision, requests arraignment be set out
Court continues bond
Recess: 1:37 pm

NEXT: (1) Schedule Arraignment 9/18/15 at 11:00 am  - Send notices

Case called at 3:07pm [mo]
Defendant Tyler W McGinnis in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court continues the already established bond
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
The Court reminds Mr. McGinnis that his bond and its condition remain in effect. 

recess: 3:10pm

NEXT: (1) PreTrial Conference: 7/1/2015 at 10:20am (2) Status Conference: 7/24/15 at 1:30pm
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Reserve Judge Mawdsley 
Case called at 11:25am [mo]
Defendant Tyler W McGinnis in court.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
The Court tolls the time limits.

The Court requires a $1500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia  
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no contact with Mitchell Barron
--no presence at the UW-Whitewater campus
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 11:30am

NEXT:   Adjourned Initial Appearance: June 19, 2015 at 2:00pm
